CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In these two cases , AFM height images showed similar surface morphology with fairly small phase separation , and the root-mean-square ( rms ) values for the blend films from DCB and from TCB are 0.242 and 0.306 nm , respectively. These AFM results are consistent with their photovoltaic device performances ( vide supra ). The reason for that may be due to both DCB and TCB are good solvents for PSFDTBT. It is well - known that balanced electron and hole mobility of the active layer is required for high performance polymer solar cells. 2f The formation of an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer donor and PCBM with an ideal domain size of 10-20 nm is crucial for charge generation and transportation. 18 For bulk heterojunction polymer solar cells , appreciate phase separation is a practical way to form bicontinuous donor - acceptor network. 19 We believe that the solar cell performance of this type of copolymer can be further improved by the optimization of film morphology and device fabrication conditions . An alternating copolymer PSFDTBT of spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole unit was designed and synthesized. PSFDTBT shows a broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility. Without using any additive and any post-treatment , polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM demonstrated a PCE of 4.6% with a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based polymers applied in BHJ PSCs. High open - circuit voltage , simple device fabrication process , and easy synthesis make PSFDTBT a highly promising donor polymers for high efficiency polymer solar cells. We believe that spirobifluorene as a promising building block for conjugated polymer donor materials warrants further exploration and the performance of PSFDTBT - based polymer solar cells can be further improved from the optimization of device fabrication conditions .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PCBM |
| PC71BM |
| spirobifluorene |

Note that I have presented the entities exactly as they appear in the original paragraph, including any capitalization and punctuation.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PCBM |
| PC71BM |

I have removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material Name":

* "Bulk heterojunction" (this term refers to a type of solar cell structure rather than a specific material)
* "Spirobifluorene" (while this is a material that has been studied for use in solar cells, it is not a specific material name mentioned in the paragraph)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Paragraph: In these two cases , AFM height images showed similar surface morphology with fairly small phase separation , and the root-mean-square ( rms ) values for the blend films from DCB and from TCB are 0.242 and 0.306 nm , respectively. Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the material properties and their values mentioned in the paragraph:

| Property | Value |
| --- | --- |
| AFM height images | 0.242 nm (DCB) and 0.306 nm (TCB) |
| root-mean-square (rms) values | 0.242 nm (DCB) and 0.306 nm (TCB) |
| electron and hole mobility | balanced electron and hole mobility is required for high performance polymer solar cells |
| domain size of 10-20 nm | crucial for charge generation and transportation |
| HOMO / LUMO positions | appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions |
| hole mobility | comparable hole mobility |
| PCE (polymer solar cell efficiency) | 4.6% |
| open-circuit voltage (Voc) | 0.94 V |
| device fabrication conditions | simple device fabrication process |
| synthesis | easy synthesis |

Note that some of the values are mentioned in the paragraph without units, but they can be easily converted based on the context.
